name: Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour

reviews.text: Beautiful location-probably the best. My room overlooked the Darling Hrbour and the city view at night from my huge hotel window caused me to sit and stare. The room was very modern, comfortable, clean, and trendy. I wanted to take the furniture home with me! My bed was a very trendy style with solid colored decorative pillows. The sheets were amazing and the comforter was white and comfortable. The bathroom was very modern with a wonderful lighting, comfy shower, and amazing showerhead. The flat screen TV was an excellent touch-but there were very few channels. Broadband connection was not free but was affordable. I loved this room and the location.
reviews.title: Very Modern

reviews.text: Booked our five nights at the Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour through wotif. Only chose this option as Saturday night seemed to have no rooms available when booking direct with Novotel. Found the "Fall in love again in Sydney" package to be the best value as it included both dinner for two and breakfast. Well it turned out not to be the best choice. The dinner for two only offered a choice of either a entre & main or main & desert from the set menu.. which only had three choices... steak, fish & chicken being the mains. Had the steak the first night which was full of gristle and as tough as a slice of rubber. My partner had the chicken fillet which came with a bone and was rare. Mentioned the lack of choices to the waiter who suggest I will have to eat something twice, when I declined the wine menu we were then ignored all night. Very poor service indeed. Tried the fish the next night which was ok, my partner had the steak which was the other half of the piece of rubber I had the night before.... the next three nights we dinned elswhere. Darling Harbour has many great restaurants which are all superior and less expensive than the Dish. Whilst we had a great room with a nice view of the harbour, room servicing was a joke. Having been out all day we were very surprised to come back to an unserviced room. Had to leave the room until around 4.30pm before it was serviced. So much for a relaxing nap before dinner. Whilst some of the staff were more than hospitable, the hotel needs a lesson from the Gold Coast with regards to looking after their guests.. Will never go back to the Novotel.. This is not a 4 star hotel by my standards.
reviews.title: Dish Restaurant? Don't wast your money......

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights for business. The location is great - easy to walk around Darling Harbour and right at the light rail and monorail stations. The room was well appointed, good quality, everything worked properly. Decent sized. Fantastic views over Darling Harbour - looks great at night.
reviews.title: Sparkly Views!

likes.liked: — good quality rooms and fantastic views - oh and block out window blind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ordered room service and it came quickly and was really good quality food.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The bed was comfy, the towels were average. All the things in the room you need - iron and board, mini bar, tea/coffee, internet, TV, very basic toiletries - in fact I didn't bother with them. the staff and the service were very good.
reviews.title: Stunning Views
Great Location, A little Pricey!
reviews.text: We've just returned from an overnight stay at The Novotel Darling Harbour. We stayed with our 2 young children in a deluxe harbour view room. Rooms have been refurbished and are very light and comfortable. The room was clean and well appointed with fantastic views. You are truly paying for the excellent location and outlook. The room was a semi 'L' shape so a sitting/workspace area was into the corner. There were 2 LCD TV's (one adjacent to the beds and the other in the lounge area) which turned out to be handy as we were able to put the boys to bed undisturbed and enjoy staying up, catching the views and watching some TV, relaxing! Staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was nice, a great start for a busy day. A definite plus was the block out shutter, no noise and total darkness. This little beauty helped us keep our young children asleep till gone 8.30am. A sleep in, What a bonus! Overall we really enjoyed our stay, but it was expensive. However, it is nice to treat and pamper yourself every now and then!

reviews.title: Great location, welcoming staff, comfortable and clean
reviews.text: I stay at this hotel on a regular basis. It is well appointed, large rooms, clean and very comfortable and has its own parking area. It is located in Darling Harbour with direct undercover access to a range of restaurants and bars. If you have booked the cheaper Pyrmont view room you might want to ask for an upgrade to a harbour view room (they might just oblige) it is much nicer.

reviews.title: Pricey but good location
reviews.text: Don't bother with the restaurant in the hotel. You will find much better value with one of the restaurants lining the harbour (although they do not stay open very late during the middle of the week - if that's the case go for the room service).

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: This is a huge hotel, dont expect any special treament as there are so many quest's. The rooms are adequite and clean, I recommend you push the boat out and have a harbour view room, the view at night is awsome. Don't waste your money on the breakfast, the restaurants on Darling Harbour will provide anything you want at half the price and great atmosphere. Same again for diner, if you want a change from DH then China Town is only a short walk accross the harbour where you can sit outside and soak in the atmosphere. Directly behind the Novotel there is a 24 hour mini market with cheap internet access. A short walk down the road from there is the casino and Lyric Theatre (we saw Miss Saigon), where there is more shops and reastuarants. After staying in Sydney for 6 days and exploring all areas I doubt this hotel can't be beaten for location.

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Stayed in a deluxe harbour view room. It was very modern and had a beautiful room of darling harbour and the city. Great location for people who have a short amount of time to see a lot of sydney. It is conveniently located in Darling Harbour and a short walk from the Casino. It is also located on the monorail which makes getting into town even easier than walking. If your wanting to keep the price down this might not be the place for you, but thats the same with most upmarket accommodation in Sydney.

The single beds look more like doubles to me. So comfortable! As mentioned by most reviews, the location is superb and the hotel is great. Most lamented the price but I got the room for a steal! With the Accord card for S$ 240, not only did I get 50% off at the restaurants but also 2 Complimentary nights for free. Even if I don't
reviews.title: Great Place! Great Spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: use the other privileges, per night work out to be only about A$100. Try not to drive if you're just staying in the town cos' the parking isn't free, not even if you're guest at the hotel. In the city, I don't think any of the hotel provide free parking. We regretted renting the car and had to search around for the best price parking. In the end, we found free overnight parking in one of the neighbourhood estate and park in the hotel early in morning when the special rate starts (Can't remember the timing cos' its been 7 months). But have to catch the timing for the special car park rates.
reviews.title: Great Location, But Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband took me to the Novotel at Darling Harbour for the weekend in January for my birthday. The hotel itself is really nice and modern but we found the service to be very ordinary. My husband had called them prior to the weekend to organise for a cake, chocolates and champagne to be made available for my birthday night as a suprise and it was ruined when it was set up the minute we arrived which was not my b'day. We also had an issue with a fire door that wasnt closing properly at the end of our hallway that was making a really loud whistling noise. We had to call four times for someone to come and fix it. We also were dissapointed with the room service. When we returned from our day out, we noticed a strong cigarette smoke smell. We thought it may be coming from the air conditioning and thought, oh well. However, when we went to throw something in the bin we noticed all this cigarette ash on the floor. We had requested a non smoking room but obviously that means only the guests dont smoke but the cleaners can. Check out took forever as they only had one staff memeber on the desk and lots of people waiting to check in/out. The restaurant is way way over priced, your better off walking to the harbour and eating by the water. Overall, i have to say it is in a great great location close to the casino and monorail, etc. but the service needs to be improved in a big way.
reviews.title: Good Facilities, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Novotel Darling Harbour in a Deluxe Harbour View room on a recent weekend away. The location is fantastic - the Darling Harbour waterfront has lots to see and do, and the monorail stops just outside so travel to the city is easy. The facilities were excellent. The rooms are modern and tidy with great views, LCD TV, fridge, etc. There is a small but well equipped gym, small swimming pool, tennis court, etc. The breakfasts are excellent.
reviews.title: Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only negative comment is that the hotel and services are a bit overpriced, eg: the room was AU$289 p/n, continental breakfast was AU$45 for 2 people (more to have the cooked selection).
reviews.title: A wonedrful hotel

likes.disliked: — Nothing went wrong for us so I don't have anything I don't like!

reviews.title: Great Location for Darling Harbour
reviews.text: I stayed at the Novotel Darling Harbour for work reasons in October 2007. I wanted to stay somewhere close to Wentworth Park in Glebe and this fitted the bill excellently as it was a less than 10 minute walk.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: This hotel is large and conveniently located in Darling Harbour directly behind the large shopping Centre on the western side. A short walk will take you to a small supermarket, food court, specialty shops and Star City Casino.

reviews.title: Great location; average hotel
reviews.text: I stayed in a Harbour View Room which was modern, well lit and had a lovely view to the east looking at city lights. The bathroom was OK, nothing special, with toiletries provided. No balcony.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: Flat Screen TV, internet connection and good black out curtains completed the package.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: Recreational Facilities were pretty basic. Small unheated outside pool (cold), tennis court and small gym facility.

Stayed here for New years eve and few nights in January. Location is fantastic and the rooms were well equipped and comfortable. We didnt have a view but the rooms were nice and quiet. Would definately recommend this for anyone visiting Sydney for short staay. Will be back.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've visited Sydney a number of times on business and chose this hotel because of its location and outlook over the city and Darling Harbour. A Deluxe Harbour View room was booked to ensure we got the best possible room/location.
reviews.title: Don't bother paying for Deluxe!!
Fantastic Time
reviews.text: On check in we were allocated a room with a small window, a wall where the harbour view should have been and a view over a conference centre and motorway flyover. When we complained we were allocated a 'standard' harbour view room. The first room allocated was certainly not 'Deluxe', only a little larger than the standard room we changed to due to the way the hotel was built. A receptionist said she would get the room manager or front office manager to get in touch with us before we left. This did not happen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not sure if the hotel think that as we were 'leisure' customers we would accept the situation but I can assure you the room they tried to allocate us as 'Deluxe Harbour View' and the service provided was not up to scratch.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I believe the hotel acts dishonestly in the way they sell this type of upgraded room. The fact that the staff did not even bother to get a manager to talk to us says volumes about the attitude of staff and the type of establishment this hotel really is. I would not recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Customer Service Not All It Should Be

aka: Novotel Sydney On Darling Harbour Hotel
description: The Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour is a 4.5 star hotel surrounded by the premier attractions of Sydney including the SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium, Powerhouse and National Maritime Museums, Star City Casino and the Entertainment Centre. The hotel has direct access to transport, making this the ideal location for business trips, holidays and city breaks. With 525 rooms boasting panoramic views of the city or towards Olympic Park, the hotel features a restaurant, bar, pool, tennis court, gym and meeting rooms.
